channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Breaking News: Oil hit $105 a barrel, natural gas prices soared and the S&P 500 slid 2.5% as global markets reeled after Russia invaded Ukraine. In Moscow, stocks collapsed and the ruble fell to a record low against the U.S. dollar. https://t.co/A5LX8839gf

Video footage verified by The New York Times captures the most intense fighting seen so far near Ukraine’s capital, Kyiv. It shows Russian helicopters attacking an airport, and appears to show at least one being shot down. https://t.co/OdphCXewKl

These are some of the first images of Russian troops entering Ukraine, verified by The New York Times.
Footage captured by security cameras at a border crossing on Thursday morning shows Russian military vehicles entering from Crimea. https://t.co/w1J4OsXVYi https://t.co/QJu38aW9Jm

President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine severed diplomatic ties with Russia as his country faced a wide-scale military attack.
He spoke as one of his advisers announced that more than 40 Ukrainian soldiers had died and dozens were wounded. https://t.co/WT2JCJ311k https://t.co/0tPQTYORxK

Russia began invading Ukraine early Thursday morning, with shelling and rocket attacks on several major cities including the capital, Kyiv.
Here’s a look at the attack, how it came to this point and what happens next. https://t.co/5REhLovamJ

Chuhuyiv, in eastern Ukraine, was hit by bombs as Russian forces attacked the country from several directions.
Firefighters raced to extinguish a fire, first aid responders cared for the injured and residents mourned the dead. https://t.co/HQBAw7BKGb https://t.co/6tsKC4YQBD
Aleksei Navalny, the jailed Russian opposition politician, condemned the invasion of Ukraine at a court hearing on Thursday. https://t.co/yJHnWkXdyN https://t.co/E2DpLxzWC5

As Russia began its invasion of Ukraine, lines of cars moved out of the capital, Kyiv, many heading west and hoping to find safety in parts of the country closer to Poland and NATO troops.
Follow live updates. https://t.co/kxpyE5YuYP https://t.co/9XBzrdTyVw

U.S. troops are preparing to move closer to Poland’s border with Ukraine to help process people fleeing after Russia invaded Ukraine, an Army spokesman said. https://t.co/PuOshlsecz https://t.co/aelsnxnnDy

Ukraine's military claimed to have shot down several Russian military aircraft as the country entered "all-out defense mode."
More than 40 Ukrainian soldiers were killed and dozens wounded on Thursday morning, an adviser to Ukraine's president said. https://t.co/ruoKNuKrhV

Video on Thursday showed burning apartment buildings near Kharkiv, Ukraine’s second largest city. The footage is evidence of a possible attack on civilian infrastructure. https://t.co/RuuvTtW1TI https://t.co/pSBq6hNnGj

Long lines formed at a bus station in Kyiv after Russian attacks were launched across Ukraine. Residents waited in line for up to an hour to buy fuel. The city’s main airport was bombed and its major roads were jammed with traffic as people fled. https://t.co/wunOx67CpZ https://t.co/h4VsK1EcWq

Shelling and missile strikes were reported across Ukraine early Thursday, as Russia launched attacks on major cities and airports and troops moved over the border.
Here are maps tracking the invasion. https://t.co/NqHp6wEABs

"There is no purgatory for war criminals. They go straight to hell."
During a heated exchange at the UN Security Council, Ukraine’s ambassador accused Russia of declaring war against his country, which the Russian ambassador denied. https://t.co/loa1RK340Y https://t.co/mghgwEghwF

China is trying to maintain a balancing act on the Ukraine crisis, even as Russia invades. A spokeswoman for China’s Foreign Ministry declined at a news briefing to condemn Russia’s actions, saying the background of the Ukraine issue was “very complicated.”https://t.co/OgpBENoNJ8

Ukraine is facing a full-scale assault by Russian troops, Dmytro Kuleba, Ukraine’s foreign minister, wrote on Twitter. He added that the country’s “defense has not collapsed” and that Ukraine “continues to defend itself.” https://t.co/mNq1OOGxI8 https://t.co/Ra7pDIEBue

Japan moved swiftly to enact sanctions against Russia on Wednesday, unlike in 2014 when it was reluctant to act after Russia annexed Crimea.
Much has changed since then, including the continuing rise of China, which has formed close ties with Russia. https://t.co/TvRN68Uhev

President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine severed diplomatic ties with Russia as his country faced a wide-scale military attack.
He spoke as one of his advisers announced that more than 40 Ukrainian soldiers had died and dozens were wounded. https://t.co/9OkK8lQr46 https://t.co/rIB63Puwg2

Russia began invading Ukraine early Thursday morning, with shelling and rocket attacks on several major cities including the capital, Kyiv.
Here’s a look at the attack, how it came to this point and what happens next. https://t.co/jk0WXQTLyy

EU leaders will hold an emergency summit on Thursday evening that will seek to quickly approve a second round of sanctions on Russia. Diplomats said several EU members were concerned about certain sectors of Russia’s economy that could be penalized. https://t.co/8KoMxgjJuC

The front page of The New York Times for Feb. 24, 2022.
Follow our updates on the Ukraine crisis. https://t.co/iby21x1qmI https://t.co/VHhRx258hO

Even with the weapons, ammunition and equipment delivered to Ukraine by Western allies recently, the Ukrainian military is badly outgunned by the larger, more technologically advanced Russian forces that have launched an invasion. https://t.co/WoGRMkx2zc

India, which relies on Russian military equipment, made no immediate statement in response to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
A day earlier, at a UN Security Council meeting, the country expressed “deep concerns,” but stopped short of criticizing Russia. https://t.co/6TUSEO0Osq

The UN Security Council held an emergency meeting on Wednesday in the hopes of stopping President Vladimir Putin from invading Ukraine.
Instead, while the council was delivering speeches, Russia did just that. https://t.co/MxzJvBEfow

Ukraine’s defense minster called on anyone looking to take up arms against Russian forces to enlist with the country’s territorial defense units. All anyone needs to sign up is a Ukrainian passport, he said. "Ukraine is moving into all-out defense mode." https://t.co/id29guwWJ0 https://t.co/NUlaMeoycO

With explosions reported across Ukraine, including in Kyiv, it quickly became clear that what President Vladimir Putin called a “special military operation” was aimed at more than the eastern rebel territories.
Here's how the attack is unfolding. https://t.co/iCuF9x4fj7

The price of oil rose above $100 a barrel for the first time since 2014, European natural gas futures jumped 31%, and Asian stocks fell on Thursday as Russia invaded Ukraine, extending market turmoil that had been driven by fears of a full-scale attack. https://t.co/RJFcHym4O0

Ukraine’s ambassador to Ankara called on Turkey to close its airspace and to close the Bosporus and Dardanelles straits to warships. The straits are the only way that ships can reach the Mediterranean from the Black Sea, where Russia has a naval fleet. https://t.co/tJRi3rwmtO

President Biden plans to impose what he called "severe sanctions" against Russia on Thursday during a public address on the Russian invasion of Ukraine, as cities were attacked across the country.
"The world will hold Russia accountable," Biden said. https://t.co/93UiQYFhEH

These are some of the first images of Russian troops entering Ukraine, verified by The New York Times.
Footage captured by security cameras at a border crossing on Thursday morning shows Russian military vehicles entering from Crimea. https://t.co/iAaop3QWru https://t.co/U9gt81z6GR

Minutes after President Vladimir Putin of Russia announced a military operation in eastern Ukraine, explosions were visible near the city of Kharkiv. By early Thursday morning, several Ukrainian cities were under attack.
Follow updates on the invasion. https://t.co/DYJz87LmcM https://t.co/o2FQHYrqsu

Prime Minister Boris Johnson is abolishing Covid regulations to move to what he says is “back towards normality.” But vulnerable people say the move will constrict their lives instead. https://t.co/oY7WxwmWy7

“Russia has chosen war,” Prime Minister Scott Morrison of Australia said at a news conference, condemning the “brutal invasion” of Ukraine and denouncing Russia’s “unilateral hostile actions.” He promised to impose further economic sanctions. https://t.co/4t25uI68Ok

As Russia began its invasion of Ukraine, lines of cars moved out of the capital, Kyiv, many heading west and hoping to find safety in parts of the country closer to Poland and NATO troops.
Follow live updates. https://t.co/PAz9fDpKyG https://t.co/mvwKd3n4zw

President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine declared martial law in the country because of the Russian invasion.
Speaking in a TV address on Thursday morning, he did not clarify what restrictions would be in place. https://t.co/fGQ0BExS5r https://t.co/9SFvnle5GX

Kyiv residents huddled inside a metro station, which serves as a bomb shelter, after air raid sirens sounded early on Thursday morning.
Several cities in Ukraine were under attack as Russia began its invasion from land and sea. https://t.co/ktTIgEkZWl https://t.co/XVIoeR0YZK

Taiwan's foreign ministry has condemned Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. The self-governed island claimed by Beijing called the attack a violation of the UN charter.
Follow our live updates on Ukraine. https://t.co/BgiGFSpauV

Three men pleaded guilty on Wednesday in a plot to attack power grids in the U.S., which they believed could lead to economic and civil unrest and create the opportunity for white leaders to rise, federal prosecutors said. https://t.co/5RWroLGOEa

Ukraine’s foreign minister, Dmytro Kuleba, said on Twitter that President Vladimir Putin of Russia had “started a full-scale war against Ukraine” and had begun shelling several cities. “This is a war of aggression,” he wrote.
Follow our live updates. https://t.co/Ww20PBJzXO

President Biden said the world would “hold Russia accountable” after explosions were seen in Ukraine on Thursday.
“President Putin has chosen a premeditated war that will bring a catastrophic loss of life and human suffering,” Biden said in a statement. https://t.co/4XEGn05Bb1

Australia has joined the effort to punish Russia for its aggression in Ukraine, with targeted travel bans and financial sanctions that will be imposed on eight individuals on Russia’s national security council. https://t.co/oUisBeJmrO

Breaking News: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has begun, the Ukrainian interior ministry said. Explosions were reported in Kyiv and other parts of the country.
Follow our live updates. https://t.co/udwRoJIL0A

President Biden: “Russia alone is responsible for the death and destruction this attack will bring, and the United States and its allies and partners will respond in a united and decisive way. The world will hold Russia accountable.”
Follow live updates. https://t.co/3e6NQSGXMk
Breaking News: President Vladimir Putin announced he had made a decision to carry out a “special military operation” in eastern Ukraine. https://t.co/rXkUJPrhmt
Breaking News: Ukraine’s president made a dramatic televised speech, appealing directly to Russia to avoid war. “The Ukrainian people want peace,” he said. https://t.co/sGgJdlHFk0

Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa, a 16-year-old chess prodigy, defeated the reigning world champion, Magnus Carlsen, in an online chess competition from his home in India on Monday. While it didn't affect Carlsen's title, the defeat stunned the chess world. https://t.co/5TLpdbZiO4

Dr. Joseph Ladapo is expected to be confirmed soon as Florida’s new surgeon general. He is against mask mandates and lockdowns, only supports vaccination campaigns if the shots are voluntary and will not say whether he himself has been vaccinated. https://t.co/0p9psimhoZ

For the first time, U.S. regulators have officially authorized a condom to be used for anal sex, not just vaginal sex. The decision, announced by the FDA on Wednesday, has long been sought by sexual health experts. https://t.co/23HeGWOFwq https://t.co/LOw0KSN4pK
Breaking News: The prosecutors leading the Manhattan district attorney’s inquiry into Donald Trump have resigned. The D.A. is said to have doubts about the case. https://t.co/n6W30FopJw

A reading of “The Communist Manifesto” in Providence, Rhode Island, was interrupted on Monday when a group of people carrying a flag with a swastika banged on the windows and shouted slurs. https://t.co/gZTa63gxdx
